title: Contact Management Library
description: Build a contact management library with input validation and formatting. ValidateEmail, ValidatePhone, FormatDisplayName, and FormatMailingAddress functions should be implemented with full test coverage.
acceptance_criteria: All four functions implemented, tested, and callable from main

title: Input Validation
description: As a developer, I want Contact fields validated on input so that malformed data is rejected before use.
acceptance_criteria: ValidateEmail and ValidatePhone exist, tested, and return descriptive errors

title: Validate email format
description:
Implement ValidateEmail(email string) error that checks for presence of @ and a domain with at least one dot.

Acceptance criteria:
- Returns nil for valid emails (user@example.com)
- Returns error for missing @ (userexample.com)
- Returns error for missing domain (user@)
- Returns error for empty string
- Error messages are descriptive
acceptance_criteria: ValidateEmail returns nil for valid emails and descriptive errors for invalid ones

title: Validate phone format
description:
Implement ValidatePhone(phone string) error that checks for a valid US phone pattern (digits, optional dashes/spaces).

Acceptance criteria:
- Returns nil for valid phones (555-0100, 5550100, 555 0100)
- Returns error for too few digits
- Returns error for letters in input
- Returns error for empty string
- Error messages are descriptive
acceptance_criteria: ValidatePhone returns nil for valid phones and descriptive errors for invalid ones

title: Contact Formatting
description: As a developer, I want Contact data formatted for display so that names and addresses render consistently.
acceptance_criteria: FormatDisplayName and FormatMailingAddress exist, tested, and produce correct output

title: Format display name
description:
Implement FormatDisplayName(c Contact) string that combines FirstName and LastName into a display-friendly format.

Acceptance criteria:
- Returns "Last, First" for contacts with both names (Smith, Alice)
- Returns just LastName when FirstName is empty
- Returns just FirstName when LastName is empty
- Returns empty string when both are empty
- No leading or trailing whitespace in output
acceptance_criteria: FormatDisplayName returns correctly formatted names for all combinations

title: Format mailing address
description:
Implement FormatMailingAddress(c Contact) string that formats address fields into a standard US mailing address.

Acceptance criteria:
- Returns multi-line format: Street\nCity, State Zip
- Omits Street line if Street is empty
- Omits City/State/Zip line if all three are empty
- Returns empty string when all address fields are empty
- No trailing newlines
acceptance_criteria: FormatMailingAddress returns correctly formatted addresses for all combinations
